image.altText: Jordans and Shane Barker composite thumb.

items.synopsis: A jury has taken just nine hours to unanimously find a Tasmanian couple guilty of murdering their former son-in-law Shane Barker in 2009.

title.children: Tasmanian couple found guilty of 2009 murder of ex son-in-law

image.altText: Noelene and Cedric Jordan pictured walking in a city street.

items.synopsis: If you saw them in the street you might think they seem like most older married couples — but a jury has just found them guilty of the shooting murder of their former son-in-law in 2009. So, why did it take 11 years to charge them?

title.children: The 'elimination matrix' which brought this grandfather and grandmother undone

image.altText: People walking in Brisbane's Queen Street Mall

items.synopsis: The latest monthly consumer price indicator shows inflation eased sharply to 5.6 per cent over the 12 months to May, down from 6.8 per cent in April. Follow out live blog for th latest updates.

title.children: Inflation drops sharply to 5.6pc, easing pressure on future interest rate rises

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The sharp drop of inflation to 5.6% has substantially taken the pressure off the RBA to increase its current rate hiking cycle. The RBA Board will meet next Tuesday to decide what to do with the cash rate, but today's substantial drop suggests a pause could be on the way — a relief for mortgage borrowers. The last time inflation was this low was in April 2022, when it was at 5.5% (which is not that long ago!). For context — the RBA's target inflation band is between 2-3%.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Falling inflation takes the pressure off the RBA to hike interest rates next week

children.content: The sharp drop of inflation to 5.6% has substantially taken the pressure off the RBA to increase its current rate hiking cycle.
The RBA Board will meet next Tuesday to decide what to do with the cash rate, but today's substantial drop suggests a pause could be on the way — a relief for mortgage borrowers.
The last time inflation was this low was in
April 2022, when it was at 5.5% (which is not that long ago!).
For context — the RBA's target inflation band is between 2-3%.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The ASX 200 has extended its gains after the latest inflation data showed a sharp pull back in price rises in May. The ASX 200 index is up by 1 per cent after the figures came out a few minutes ago. And the Australian dollar extended its losses. It's fallen by 0.8 per cent to around 66.34. That suggests that traders think the chance of an RBA rate rise next week is less likely.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: ASX rises, dollars fall as inflation eases back

children.content: The ASX 200 has extended its gains after the latest inflation data showed a sharp pull back in price rises in May.
The ASX 200 index is up by 1 per cent after the figures came out a few minutes ago.
And the Australian dollar extended its losses.
It's fallen by 0.8 per cent to around 66.34.
That suggests that traders think the chance of an RBA rate rise next week is less likely.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The Bureau of Statistics says there's been a big cool down in the pace of price increases over the year to May. Consumer inflation rose by 5.6 per cent over the year. That's compared to a 6.8 per cent rise over the year to April when petrol prices drove the increase.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Price rises ease to 5.6% in May

children.content: The Bureau of Statistics says there's been a big cool down in the pace of price increases over the year to May.
Consumer inflation rose by 5.6 per cent over the year.
That's compared to a 6.8 per cent rise over the year to April when petrol prices drove the increase.

image.altText: A young woman with blonde hair sits in a room and smiles

items.synopsis: The sister of missing Belgian tourist Celine Cremer makes a plea on social media for help locating the 31-year-old, with police concerned for her welfare after locating her car in a waterfall car park.

title.children: 'Help us find her': Sister's plea as police locate car of missing Belgian tourist

image.altText: A stained glass church window with a decorative pattern in green, orange and red glass

items.synopsis: Catholic Education Tasmania is reviewing a religious instruction course planned for college students next year after feedback from principals. An LGBTIQA+ support group has called it "discriminatory" and has threatened to lodge formal complaints.

title.children: Fears Catholic school course 'will give LGBTIQA+ students the impression there's something wrong with them'

image.altText: A young woman with blonde hair and glasses stands in front of rows of bread and smiles

items.synopsis: As the current financial year comes to an end, councils across Tasmania are upping their rates, leaving residents and business owners struggling to balance the books.

image.altText: A black and white graphic of the two men against a Russian map with a red semi-circle behind them.

items.synopsis: Recent developments in Russia raise serious questions about the future of President Vladimir Putin and the war in Ukraine. Join our live Q&A as our experts unpack your questions.

image.altText: Three-year-old William Tyrrell has been missing from his NSW mid north coast home since late last week.

image.altText: A blue sleeve with a Victoria Police badge sewn into it, including the motto "Uphold the Right".

items.synopsis: A teenage girl is under police guard in hospital after allegedly being behind the wheel of a crash in northern Victoria that has left a female passenger dead.

image.altText: Smoke rises from Loy Yang Power Station, which is seen in silhouette against a yellow sunset

image.altText: Scott Morrison, wearing a long winter jacket, walks out of a construction site followed by two men and a woman.

image.altText: Gambling advertisement at an AFL game.

image.altText: A man in a business shirt and tie looks seriously off the camera.

items.synopsis: The Northern Territory Court of Appeal has dismissed former NT Police constable Zachary Rolfe's bid to avoid questions at the coronial inquest into the death of Kumanjayi Walker.

title.children: Court rules Zachary Rolfe must give evidence at Kumanjayi Walker inquest

image.altText: a tub of coyo yogburt sitting on a bench in the sun

items.synopsis: A Sunshine Coast company which manufactures "dairy-free" coconut yoghurt and ice cream products is being sued in the Queensland Supreme Court following a woman's death in the UK.

image.altText: A toddler strapped into a pram.

items.synopsis: The death of 17-month-old Ronan this month is declared a major crime. No arrests have been made or charges laid. Here's a look at what is known so far. WARNING: This story contains details readers may find distressing.

title.children: This 17-month-old was allegedly murdered — here's what we know so far about Ronan's death

image.altText: Servicemen sit in a tank with a flag of the Wagner Group military company.

image.altText: Jason Clare speaks at a lecturn in front of Australian flags

image.altText: A football player with blue hair smiles at another player as the take questions at a press conference.

image.altText: A woman in a white dress holds up two gold statue awards and smiles

image.altText: A man smiles while wearing Baltimore Ravens football gear.

image.altText: Julian Sands wearing open-neck blue shirt and purple jacket staring into camera.

image.altText: Lukashenko confirms Wagner chief Prigozhin's arrival in Belarus

items.synopsis: Russian authorities close a criminal investigation into the aborted armed rebellion led by mercenary chief Yevgeny Prigozhin, and are pressing no charges against him or his troops.

image.altText: The back of a white ute, with the word "Jovi" graffitied on the back in black spraypaint.

image.altText: An aerial view of Alice Springs by night.

items.synopsis: Police say the month of May was the quietest recorded in Alice Springs since 2019, allowing for some pause for officers on the ground.

image.altText: Flames and smoke rose from a house burning in the town of Goroka.

image.altText: A diver swims up to an orange coral in the sea.

image.altText: An angry look cassowary looks up at the camera.

image.altText: Convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein in his 2017 mug shot.

image.altText: An octogenarian white man in a brown hat and jacket stands in a town square with a white brunette woman in a white hat and shirt

items.synopsis: Taking over the reins from George Lucas and Steven Spielberg, director James Mangold had his work cut out for him bringing this four-decade story to a close. Did he succeed?
